hypothesis_content.title: ETH/BTC Ratio Extreme Reversion Post-News Spike
hypothesis_content.statement: When ETH/BTC ratio experiences a >5% single-day move driven by news headlines, it will revert 50-70% of that move within the next 3 trading days, regardless of regime.
hypothesis_content.rationale: News-driven moves often overreact due to headline chasing. ETH/BTC ratio tends to be range-bound structurally. The 'Great Reversion' warning in recent news suggests broader mean-reversion pressures across markets.
entry_conditions: News sentiment score (crypto-specific) spikes >2 standard deviations
Open interest change in ETH futures < ratio change (disproportionate)
Entry on close of the spike day

exit_conditions.take_profit: Ratio retraces 60% of the initial spike
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Ratio extends beyond initial spike by >2%

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: If news-driven spikes lead to sustained regime shifts >50% of the time, invalidating the overreaction premise.
